trans-unit.source: How to: Add or remove Access Control List entries (.NET Framework only)
How to: Add or remove Access Control List entries (.NET Framework only)

To add or remove Access Control List (ACL) entries to or from a file or directory, get the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> or <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> object from the file or directory.
Modify the object, and then apply it back to the file or directory.
Add or remove an ACL entry from a file

Call the <xref:System.IO.File.GetAccessControl%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to get a <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> object that contains the current ACL entries of a file.
Add or remove ACL entries from the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> object returned from step 1.
To apply the changes, pass the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> object to the <xref:System.IO.File.SetAccessControl%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
Add or remove an ACL entry from a directory

Call the <xref:System.IO.Directory.GetAccessControl%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to get a <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> object that contains the current ACL entries of a directory.
Add or remove ACL entries from the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> object returned from step 1.
To apply the changes, pass the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> object to the <xref:System.IO.Directory.SetAccessControl%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
You must use a valid user or group account to run this example.
Use the same procedure for the <xref:System.IO.FileInfo>, <xref:System.IO.Directory>, and <xref:System.IO.DirectoryInfo> classes.
